info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 6 at 12:14AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 1213 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Orangetree, or near Golden Gate Estates, moving south at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Naples, Golden Gate Estates, Belle Meade, Orangetree, Naples Manor, Golden Gate, East Naples, Lely Resort, Big Corkscrew Island, West Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Vineyards, North Naples, Lely, Rookery Bay Aquatic Preserve, Intersection I-75 And Everglades Blvd, and Fiddlers Creek.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Collier County through 100 AM EDT

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County
